Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photograph was taken during Hurricane Matthew in October 2016 when it was actually taken in May 2009 during heavy rains.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the connection between the photograph and Hurricane Matthew, implying that it shows the speedway flooded during the hurricane when it does not.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by incorrectly associating the photograph with Hurricane Matthew in October 2016.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the connection between the photograph and Hurricane Matthew.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the photograph is related to Hurricane Matthew without any factual basis.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the photograph being taken in May 2009 during heavy rains instead of during Hurricane Matthew in October 2016.
